intro: Erythrodes ovata, commonly known as the oval-fruited redseed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of small, red flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
